org.orgName: District Court of the United States

div1.p: IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the Matter of the Application of MAC FOCK, for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
UNITED STATES OF AMERICA WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON } ss

I, VICTOR M. PLACE, hereby certify: that I am one of the Counsel of record in the above entitled cause; that while I believe in the desire of his Honor, Judge Cushman, to try the matters at issue herein fairly and impartially, I believe the matters and things set forth by Mac Fock are true and verily believe that said are made in good faith by said Mac Fock, and that the affidavit herein made is not to hinder or dely justice or to reflect upon the judicial integrity or character of his Honor, Judge Cushman, but under the belief from all the facts of his past life, that he is not judicially tempered to try the matters at issue herein fairly and impartially.
Dated at Seattle, Washington, this 23 day of June, A.D. 1913.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 23 day of June, A.D. 1913.
Notary Public in and for the State of Washington, residing at Seattle.
